brief_title: Study of Olanzapine vs. Aripiprazole in the Treatment of Schizophrenia
brief_summary: The purpose of the protocol is to evaluate the efficacy of olanzapine compared with Aripiprazole in patients with schizophrenia.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: - Male or female inpatient or outpatients, ages 18-65 Exclusion Criteria: - Participation in a clinical trial of another drug including olanzapine or aripiprazole within 30 days prior to study entry (visit 1). - Treatment with clozapine within the past 12 months. - Have known uncorrected narrow-angle glaucoma. - Have a diagnosis of Parkinson's disease, dementia or related disorder
